summary: The 'Stopping Terrorists Online Presence and Holding Accountable Tech Entities Act of 2025' mandates social media companies to publish their terms of service regarding foreign terrorist organizations and Specially Designated Global Terrorists. They must also report data on content moderation, user actions, and appeals to the Attorney General triannually, making these reports public. Failure to comply can result in civil penalties.  The Director of National Intelligence and the Comptroller General are required to issue reports. The act aims to limit the online presence of terrorist organizations, ensuring transparency and accountability in content moderation. The act includes a sunset clause. It also stipulates that nothing in the bill shall be construed to infringe upon any right protected under the First Amendment to the Constitution of the United States.
